VLIB_image_rescale

Detailed Description


Functions

void VLIB_image_rescale (const uint8_t pIn[], uint8_t pOut[], uint16_t nFactor, uint16_t inCols, uint16_t inRows, int32_t color_format)

Function Documentation

void VLIB_image_rescale ( const uint8_t  pIn[],
uint8_t  pOut[],
uint16_t  nFactor,
uint16_t  inCols,
uint16_t  inRows,
int32_t  color_format 
)

Description
This function scales scales the input image to a different resolution.
Parameters:
[in] pIn[] 8-bit input image array to one of the image channels (UQ8.0)
[out] pOut[] 8-bit output array to one of the image channels (UQ8.0)
[in] nFactor Fixed point approximation of scaling factor (Luma only, UQ16.0) Scaling factor = 4096/nFactor
[in] inCols Image width in number of pixels (UQ16.0)
[in] inRows Image height in number of pixels (UQ16.0)
[in] color_format Color format option (SQ31.0)
  • 0: COLOR_FORMAT_YUV_422_YUYV
  • 1: COLOR_FORMAT_YUV_422_UYVY
  • 3: COLOR_FORMAT_LUMA_ONLY
  • All other values reserved (not supported)
Limitations
  • When color_format is 0 : COLOR_FORMAT_YUV_422_YUYV or 1 : COLOR_FORMAT_YUV_422_UYVY :
    • nFactor is ignored, only 1/2 downscale in each direction is supported (output is 1/4 pixels as input)
    • pIn aligned to an 8 byte boundary
    • pOut aligned to an 4 byte boundary
    • inCols is a multiple of 8
    • inRows is a multiple of 2
  • When color_format is 3 : COLOR_FORMAT_LUMA_ONLY :
    • nFactor is supported, such that output_dimension = input_dimention*4096/nFactor
    • Upscaling and downscaling are supported
    • Max dimension of output width or height when color_format is 1920
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
